definition: to vanish gradually/to disappear/to fade out

sentences.english: The real war will never get in the books.
sentences.chinese: 真正的戰爭永遠會隱沒於歷史的黑暗面。

sentences.english: The summit of the mountain is lost in the cloud and mist.
The top of the mountain vanishes into the clouds, or on cloudless days, into the sun.
sentences.chinese: 山頂隱沒於雲間，在沒雲的日子，則消失在陽光裏。

sentences.english: By contrast, rich nations suffer from deep sunk costs and entrenched vested interests.
sentences.chinese: 與之相比，富國將遭殃於深厚的隱沒成本及既得利益。

sentences.english: Hope fades into the world of night through shadows falling out of memory and time.
sentences.chinese: 希望已隱沒在夜晚，將擺脫黑暗，穿越記憶和時間。

sentences.english: She slipped out the door and disappeared into the dark barn .
sentences.chinese: 她一溜煙走出門外，隱沒在馬房的黑暗中。

sentences.english: Clouds spread across the moon, fading it out.
sentences.chinese: 雲朵漂過月亮，漸漸將它隱沒。

sentences.english: The bottom of the garden was lost in mist and darkness.
sentences.chinese: 園子的盡頭隱沒在迷霧和夜色中了。

sentences.english: On the horizon I could see the highway disappearing into the hills.
sentences.chinese: 我能看到高速公路在地平線上正隱沒在羣山裏。

sentences.english: Peoples, like planets, possess the right to an eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 人民和星宿一樣，有權暫時隱沒。

sentences.english: Confucius disciples of the Queen who died or subduction city at this time mostly wild.
sentences.chinese: 孔子的嫡傳弟子們此時大多辭世或隱沒市野。

sentences.english: The twin suns are setting behind a black wall of alien trees.
sentences.chinese: 兩個孿生的太陽西下，漸漸隱沒在林間。

sentences.english: But the darkness was already fading, anyway.
sentences.chinese: 無論如何，黑暗是漸漸隱沒了。

sentences.english: The moon retired from view behind dark clouds.
sentences.chinese: 月亮隱沒在烏雲後面看不見了。

definition: to turn a blind eye to
turbid flow/muddy waters/fig. a contemptible person/fig. corrupt or disgraceful social trends
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
